text: [Objective of Battle Historia] The objective is to defeat the Boss at the end of your adventure. Check Map>BOSS for details.
[Battle Historia Special Rule 1] During your adventure, your party's HP and LP will carry over after battles. Try not to take too much damage.
[Battle Historia Special Rule 2] All skills are set to Rank 99, and all Styles are set to Lv 30. Your Styles will have all their abilities unlocked.
[Assigning Warriors] Each adventure begins with a new party. When you start Historia, you will have five random Styles assigned to your party.
[Types of Map Tiles] On the map, there are many types of tiles such as Style, Event, Party Ability, Normal Foe, Mighty Foe tiles, and more.
[Style Tiles] You can choose 1 out of 3 Styles to swap with an existing member in your party.
[Party Ability Tiles] You can choose 1 out of 3 party abilities.
[Normal Foe Tiles] A battle with the enemy awaits. The further you go, the stronger the enemies become.
[Mighty Foe Tiles] A battle with the mighty foe awaits. Party members will develop greatly and you will get better rewards.
[Surprise Attack] Right before a battle, there is a chance that a Normal Foe battle will turn into a Mighty Foe battle.
[Treasure Chest Tiles] If you succeed in opening the treasure chest, your party will be enhanced, but if you fail, there will be a penalty.
[Treasure Chests (Random)] Right before you move to the next tile, there is a chance that a treasure chest will appear. Decide carefully if you want to open it.
[Grasp/Learn When Recruiting Warriors] When a warrior joins, the new recruit will learn as many skills/spells as the Style that left your party had learned.
[Style Swap] On Style tiles, you can swap the Style youâ€™ve selected with a Style in your party. Styles of the same character cannot be in the party at the same time.
[Dodge Skills] In Battle Historia, you can learn dodge skills. Once a dodge skill is learned, you will completely dodge the skill/spell when an enemy uses it.
[Grasp/Learn] In Battle Historia, depending on the weapon type/spell affinity, Styles can learn skills/spells that were originally unavailable to them.
[Items] Consume items in battle to help the party pre-action. The amount of effect is based on the average of the party members' attributes.
[Party Abilities] Available only in Battle Historia. The effect applies to the entire party.
[HP Recovery on Map] Styles with 2 or more LP can use 1 LP to fully restore HP.
[Give Up] Give up on the adventure and end the Historia. It is one way to quit gracefully if you feel you cannot go any further on the map.
[Results] On the Results screen, you can view your adventure log. Look back on your one and only adventure.
